numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The headline is: There are advantages in elite college admissions.
2. A student whose parents' income is in the top 5 percent is far more likely to be admitted into a prestigious university.
3. A student whose parents' income is in the 70th percentile to the 95th percentile is accepted less frequently.
4. A legacy applicant is far more likely to be admitted into a prestigious university.
5. I wonder why a university cares so much about a student's wealth in the admission process.
6. A student from a low-income household is at a disadvantage in the admission process.
7. A first-generation college student is at a disadvantage in the admission process.
9. Some universities offer resources for first-generation college students.
10. These resources help first-generation college students to excel after high school.
